definition: An ounce of gold can't buy you an interval of time (idiom); Money can't buy you time./Time is precious.
pinyin: cun4 jin1 nan2 mai3 cun4 guang1 yin1

definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia
lit. An interval of time is worth an ounce of gold, money cannot buy you time. (idiom)/fig. Time is precious and must be treasured.
pinyin: yi1 cun4 guang1 yin1 yi1 cun4 jin1 , cun4 jin1 nan2 mai3 cun4 guang1 yin1

definition: lit. An interval of time is worth an ounce of gold. (idiom)/fig. free time is to be treasured

definition: if you are lazy in your prime, you'll be sorry in your old age

related.word: 少壮不努力，老大徒伤悲

definition: a very brief period of time (lit. the time it takes for a shadow to move an inch)
the sun and moon like a shuttle (idiom); How time flies!
sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis
time flies like an arrow (idiom); How time flies!

If you work at it hard enough, you can grind an iron bar into a needle./cf idiom 磨杵成針|磨杵成针, to grind an iron bar down to a fine needle (idiom); fig. to persevere in a difficult task/to study diligently

definition: a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
